The part 1 has a length of 0.2, width of 0.5 and a height of 0.2. Part 2: A cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom as follows: 1. **Create a new coordinate system**: Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector to [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. 2. **Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane**: - Draw a circle with a center at (0.1, 0.1) and a radius of 0.1. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**: Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D**: Rotate the sketch by -90.0 degrees about the Z-axis and translate it along the Z-axis by 0.0 units. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch**: Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units towards the normal. The part 2 has a length of 0.2, width of 0.25 and a height of 0.2. The final shape will be obtained by combining Part 1 and Part 2 using the appropriate boolean operation (i.e. NewBodyFeatureOperation). The combined shape will be the metallic tube or pipe as described in the final_shape field of the given assembly JSON. The height of the final shape will be 0.2, width will be 0.5 and length will be 0.2.</description>
